channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 即时新闻：美国总统拜登表示，美国将向加沙空投援助物资，并将巴勒斯坦人在车队附近被杀与对物资的绝望联系在一起。
item.description:
Breaking News: The U.S. will airdrop aid to Gaza, said President Biden, who linked the killing of Palestinians near a convoy to desperation for supplies. https://t.co/vQYE461Soc

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 加沙当局称，周四清晨在加沙城，一群人聚集在援助卡车周围，以色列军队开火，造成 100 多人死亡，数百人受伤。以下是需要了解的情况。
item.description:
Gazan authorities said that more than 100 people were killed and hundreds more injured early Thursday morning in Gaza City, where a crowd gathered around aid trucks and the Israeli military opened fire. Here's what to know. https://t.co/Qx3iecar6h

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 成千上万的人来到莫斯科参加阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼的葬礼。一些人冒着被捕的危险高喊 "反对战争"。纳瓦尔尼先生的灵柩在西纳特拉的歌曲 "我的路 "和电影 "终结者 2 "的旋律中被送入墓地。
item.description:
Thousands turned out for the funeral for Aleksei Navalny in Moscow. Some shouted, “No to war,” risking arrest. Mr. Navalny’s coffin was lowered into the cemetery grounds to the strains of the Sinatra song “My Way” and one from the movie “Terminator 2.” https://t.co/qQONVkHj4v

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 2019 年一座火山岛喷发后，受害者及其家属共获得了约 1020 万新西兰元的赔偿，约合 620 万美元。
item.description:
After a volcanic island erupted in 2019, victims and their families have been awarded a total of about 10.2 million New Zealand dollars, or roughly $6.2 million. https://t.co/4DJZKsLY6A

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 印度最富有的人之一的儿子举行了为期三天的婚前仪式，提高了奢华庆典的标准。
item.description:
A three-day pre-wedding ceremony for the son of one of India’s richest men raises the bar for extravagant festivity. https://t.co/GqZyFSGuWb

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 更多的美国武器将很快在美国之外制造。由于战争使美国的武器库捉襟见肘，华盛顿正寻求与澳大利亚等合作伙伴一起扩大生产。
item.description:
More American weapons will soon be made outside America. With the wars straining U.S. arsenals, Washington is seeking to expand production with partners like Australia. https://t.co/gWB3BwOkj1

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 克劳迪娅-谢恩鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）是一名物理学家，也是现任总统的门生，她以约 30 个百分点的绝对优势领先于反对党的 Xóchitl Gálvez（一名科技企业家），竞选活动将于周五正式开始。
item.description:
Claudia Sheinbaum, a physicist and protégée of the current president, holds a commanding lead of about 30 percentage points over the opposition’s Xóchitl Gálvez, a tech entrepreneur, as campaigning officially starts on Friday https://t.co/dZU0xM5r3r

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 肯尼亚政府与海地签署了一项协议，将在这个黑帮横行的加勒比国家部署一支多国部队，推进一项备受争议的计划。
item.description:
Kenya’s government signed an agreement with Haiti to deploy a multinational force in the gang-ravaged Caribbean nation, pushing ahead with a controversial plan that has been criticized by rights groups and blocked by a court in the East African nation. https://t.co/wdaseyBU5z

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 在 20 世纪 90 年代的经济动荡中，中国工业中心地带的数百万劳动者失去了工作。犯罪率和贫困率上升。双雪涛是中国最著名的青年作家之一，他的散文中充满了这种集体苦难的遗产。
item.description:
In the economic upheaval of the 1990s, millions of laborers in China’s industrial heartland lost their jobs. Crime and poverty rose. The legacy of that communal suffering animates the prose of Xuetao Shuang, one of China’s most celebrated young authors. https://t.co/4EynOoifBg

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 左派激进分子乔治-加洛韦（George Galloway）赢得了英格兰北部罗奇代尔（Rochdale）议会席位的选举，在此之前，他进行了一场混乱的竞选活动，显示出英国政界对加沙战争的愤怒情绪。
item.description:
George Galloway, a leftist firebrand, won an election for the parliamentary seat in Rochdale, northern England, after a chaotic campaign that showed the anger sweeping through British politics over the war in Gaza. https://t.co/xPnhIF5SO6

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯最著名的反对派人物阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼在北极偏远的刑罚殖民地神秘死亡两周后，莫斯科为他举行的葬礼排起了长队。
item.description:
Long lines of people were forming in Moscow for the funeral services for Aleksei Navalny, Russia’s most prominent opposition figure, two weeks after his mysterious death in a remote Arctic penal colony. https://t.co/wI5gURCWOw

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 他在所谓 "伟大事业 "上的政治家风范，从北美的自由贸易和酸雨，到推翻南非的种族隔离制度，在他卸任后都被指责为财务失当和影响力操纵。
item.description:
His statesmanship on what he called “great causes,” from free trade and acid rain in North America to the overthrow of apartheid in South Africa, gave way to accusations of financial misdoing and influence-peddling after he left office. https://t.co/XqaMprasPC

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 加拿大第 18 任总理布莱恩-马尔罗尼（Brian Mulroney）去世，享年 84 岁。
item.description:
Brian Mulroney, Canada’s 18th prime minister, has died at 84. https://t.co/Md0nD0R7rQ

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 加拿大将开始要求墨西哥公民入境时必须持有签证，此举是为了应对墨西哥国民入境避难申请的增加。
item.description:
Canadá empezará a exigir visa a los ciudadanos mexicanos para entrar al país, una medida que sucede cuando se registra un aumento en las solicitudes de asilo de mexicanos que llegan al país. https://t.co/P9RdPr5Hno

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 每一次核剑拔弩张都是为了达到同样的基本目的：弗拉基米尔-普京知道，他的对手最担心乌克兰冲突升级
item.description:
Each instance of nuclear saber‌ rattling has served the same basic purpose: Vladimir Putin knows that his opponents fear escalation of the conflict in Ukraine most of all‌ https://t.co/93HjUQgv0Q

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 29, 2024

item.title: 乍得反对党领导人亚亚-迪洛（Yaya Dillo）原本有望参加五月份的全国大选。但据国家检察官称，他和许多其他人在首都的一场枪战中丧生。
item.description:
Chad’s opposition leader, Yaya Dillo, had been expected to run in national elections in May. But he was killed alongside many others in a gun battle in the capital, according to the national prosecutor. https://t.co/YKuuezGVay

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 29, 2024

item.title: 加拿大国家情报局的文件和一项安全调查显示，两名曾在该国顶级微生物实验室工作的科学家向中国传递了秘密科学信息。
item.description:
Documents from Canada’s national intelligence agency and a security investigation indicate that two scientists formerly at the country’s top microbiology lab passed on secret scientific information to China. https://t.co/mQGyFwGXRX

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 29, 2024

item.title: 在为穿越丛林运送移民的主要公司工作的两名船长被捕后，通过危险的达连海峡前往美国的移民活动至少暂时停止了。
item.description:
La migración hacia EE. UU. a través del peligroso tapón del Darién se ha detenido, al menos temporalmente, tras el arresto de dos capitanes de embarcaciones que trabajaban para empresas clave en el transporte de migrantes por la selva. https://t.co/UTXP9vXQSz

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 29, 2024

item.title: 加拿大将开始要求墨西哥国民入境时必须持有签证，此举正值抵达加拿大的墨西哥人避难申请激增之际。
item.description:
Canada will start requiring visas for Mexican nationals to enter the country, a move that comes amid a surge in asylum requests from Mexicans arriving in Canada. https://t.co/c8nf66rtdh

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 29, 2024

item.title: 因暴力镇压女性抗议者而恼羞成怒、因多年来操纵投票而心怀不满的选民们发誓要在周五的选举中留在家中以示抗议。
item.description:
Voters enraged by a violent crackdown on female protesters and disaffected by years of voting manipulation are vowing to make a statement by staying home during Friday’s elections. https://t.co/kWUIeyuLLm

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 29, 2024

item.title: 该国的政治似乎陷入了僵局，因为一个政党无论丑闻缠身、多么不得人心，都几乎牢牢地掌握着权力。但不用担心。这里是日本，所有坏消息都是相对的。
item.description:
The country’s politics appear frozen as one party holds a virtual lock on power no matter how scandal-tainted and unpopular it becomes. But not to worry. This is Japan, where all bad news is relative. https://t.co/YoX7iatVUO

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 29, 2024

item.title: 一项调查称，2021 年杀害莎拉-埃弗拉德（Sarah Everard）的伦敦警官根本就不应该被雇用，调查中提到了他过去的过失。
item.description:
The London police officer who killed Sarah Everard in 2021 should never have been hired, an inquiry says, citing red flags from his past that were missed. https://t.co/Cbm1DaYaA9

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 29, 2024

item.title: 即时新闻：以色列军队在一个援助车队附近开火，造成多人伤亡。各方对事件经过的说法截然不同。
item.description:
Breaking News: Many were killed and injured after Israeli forces opened fire near an aid convoy. Starkly different accounts of what happened were offered. https://t.co/5LJMxPnRva

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 29, 2024

item.title: 哥伦比亚的主要机场已成为大批移民前往美国的枢纽。一些人已经滞留数周，或被强行遣返。
item.description:
Colombia’s main airport has become a hub for migrants heading to the U.S. in greater numbers. Some have been stranded for weeks, or forcibly turned back. https://t.co/dSWlEsFT3y

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 29, 2024

item.title: 居住在最近被占领的阿夫迪耶夫卡以西的乌克兰农民和矿工及其家人正准备在俄罗斯人的进攻下逃离。
item.description:
Ukrainian farmers and miners and their families who live to the west of the recently captured Avdiivka are poised to flee in the face of a Russian onslaught. https://t.co/C0s8gJu583

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 29, 2024

item.title: 五名曾与这位俄罗斯反对派领导人在同一监狱服刑的男子描述了难以忍受的寒冷、难吃的食物、不卫生的条件和殴打。但心理压力和孤独感更为严重。
item.description:
Five men who did time in the same penal colony as the Russian opposition leader described unbearable cold, repulsive food, unsanitary conditions and beatings. But the psychological pressure and loneliness was even worse. https://t.co/6Qh2mctdtx

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 29, 2024

item.title: 乍得检察官宣布，中非国家乍得的主要反对派领导人周三在其位于首都的政党总部发生的枪战中丧生。
item.description:
The main opposition leader in the central African nation of Chad was killed on Wednesday in a shootout at his party headquarters in the capital, the country’s prosecutor has announced. https://t.co/N6LSJw6ROB

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 29, 2024

item.title: 在韩国数千名医生罢工一周多之后，他们与政府之间的纠纷仍没有解决的迹象。以下是韩国医生抗议活动的相关信息。
item.description:
More than a week after thousands of doctors walked off the job in South Korea, their dispute with the government shows no signs of resolution.

Here’s what to know about the doctor protests in the country. https://t.co/guq8tfwidV

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 29, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯的弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）对西方的威胁升级，称如果西方更直接地干预乌克兰，将面临核冲突的风险。"他说："我们也有武器可以打击他们领土上的目标。"他们难道不明白这一点吗？
item.description:
Vladimir Putin of Russia escalated his threats against the West, saying if it intervened more directly in Ukraine it risked nuclear conflict. “We also have weapons that can strike targets on their territory,” he said. “Do they not understand this?” https://t.co/EhW15WSPpJ

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 29, 2024

item.title: "有人警告我：'贝尔莫潘是为新婚夫妇或濒临死亡的人准备的'，"这位艺术学校的校长谈到她离开沿海繁华的伯利兹城搬到贝尔莫潘时听到的评论。
item.description:
“Me advirtieron: ‘Belmopán es para los recién casados o los casi muertos’”, dijo la propietaria de una escuela de arte, sobre los comentarios que le hicieron cuando dejó la costera y bulliciosa Ciudad de Belice para mudarse a Belmopán. https://t.co/R3WIlnv8AX

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024
